resources.string: There is no great joy than saving a soul
You will get SMS with a confirmation code to this number.
Following guidelines laid down by the Ministry of Health, Government of India have to be followed by an individual donating blood:
The donor must be fit and healthy, and should not be suffering from transmittable diseases.
The donor must be 18–65 years old and should weigh a minimum of 50 kg.
Should be normal, with an oral temperature not exceeding 37.5 °C.
The time period between successive blood donations should be more than 3 months.
Individuals under certain conditions are deemed ineligible to donate blood:
1.A person who has been tested HIV positive.
2.Individuals suffering from ailments like cardiac arrest, hypertension, blood pressure, cancer, epilepsy, kidney ailments and diabetes.
3.A person who has undergone ear/body piercing or tattoo in the past 6 months.
4.Individuals who have undergone immunization in the past 1 month.
5.Individuals treated for rabies or received Hepatitis B vaccine in the past 6 months.
6.A person who has consumed alcohol in the past 24 hours.
8.Individuals who have undergone major dental procedures or general surgeries in the past 1 month.
9.Women who have had miscarriage in the past 6 months.
10.Individuals who have had fits, tuberculosis, asthma and allergic disorders in the past.
Please fill in your personal details
I authorize this app and state that I am above 18 years of age
I agree to display my details so that the nearby needy can contact me.
I agree to the terms and conditions.
1. People registering on this site must understand that the information provided by them on the registration page is available to a person seeking for a particular blood group.
2. We do not sell contact details of potential donors to any third party or use it in any way for commercial gains.
3. We does not arrange for blood. We only provide relevant information about potential donors to those in need of blood.
4. We do not have a blood bank and is not affiliated to any blood bank.
5. We do not guarantee that a potential donor will agree to donate blood whenever called upon to do so. It is entirely at the discretion of the individual whether or not to donate blood.

6. We does not claim that potential donors are free from any disease, ailment, or bodily conditions preventing them from donating blood at the time when they are contacted for blood donation. Onus is completely on the individual looking for blood to verify these details from the donor.
7. We urge you not to make false registrations if you do not seriously wish to donate blood. It is a matter of life and death for those in need of blood in an emergency or otherwise.
8. We reserves right to inactivate member at any given time in case found wrong information given or misuse of service
Over 1200 road crashes and around 500 million surgeries and operations every day require large quantities of blood daily.
Shortage of blood leads to poor maternal and infant mortality rate and affects health rate.
